name: DCAU
description: The classic animated continuity started by Batman: The Animated Series.

media.name: Superman: Brainiac Attacks
media.timeline_note: This movie is not considered canon to the DCAU by the creators.

media.name: Lobo (Webseries)
media.timeline_note: This webseries is not officially considered part of the DCAU but was created by some of the same team and is often associated with it.

media.name: Static Shock
media.timeline_note: The episodes 'The Big Leagues', 'Hard as Nails', and 'A League of Their Own' Parts 1 & 2 feature crossovers with the Justice League and occur during the 'Justice League' series timeline. 'Future Shock' is a crossover with 'Batman Beyond' and takes place during that show's timeline.

media.name: Justice League Unlimited
media.timeline_note: The episode 'Epilogue' should be watched after 'Batman Beyond' and 'Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker'.

media.name: Batman and Harley Quinn
media.timeline_note: The canonicity of this film is debatable. While executive producer Bruce Timm considers it canon, it is often seen as a standalone story.

media.name: Justice League vs. The Fatal Five
media.timeline_note: Similar to 'Batman and Harley Quinn', the canonicity of this film is open to interpretation. Executive producer Bruce Timm regards it as canon.

media.name: The Zeta Project
media.timeline_note: This series is a spin-off of 'Batman Beyond'.

media.name: Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker

relationships.reason: Batman: Caped Crusader is a spiritual successor to the DCAU from original creator Bruce Timm and exists within the Elseworlds collection.
